text: bus after bus packed with refugees dream
in some of the world's biggest camps can
now be found here over two and a half
thousand South Deniz arrived in the
country daily most have travelled for
weeks by foot to get to Uganda the
passengers bring with them
painful testimony it took beccaj one a
month to get here but the trauma of her
five-year-old son's disappearance still
haunts her gunman raided my village I
was in the market and when I got home I
couldn't find my son Isaac I searched
but he was nowhere in the end I had to
flee with my three other children and
just a handful of clothes Margaret had a
only manage to carry her handbag a
grandmother she looked for three weeks
this was a painful journey she tells us
the crisis is getting worse he looked
back those food at home but how can we
collect it the fighters are there
morning afternoon and night we had to
leave with whatever we could carry on
our head and some of these things we had
to walk along the way South Sudan is the
world's newest country but has already
been wracked by three years of conflict
and the President and Vice President
turned their political rivalry into an
ethnic rule nobody really knows how many
people have been killed but over three
million have been displaced and this the
UN says has caused a famine in parts of
the country it's not that there's no
food in South Sudan if just that people
cannot access it because of the constant
fighting people can't plant harvest of
goes to market and if the fighting
continues more and more people will be
forced to abandon their homes and become
a refugee Mary and Rose were neighbors
back home in South Sudan and when
fighting erupted in their village they
fled together they had to hide out in
the bush on their way to safety
surviving on wild roots Ln an akela
soldiers surrounded the house at night
and asked my husband in a seven
brothers to command they shot them in
front of our home I lay down on the
floor with the children and only managed
to run away when the gunshot stop us at
our world despite the efforts as peace
there's no clear sign that the world is
about to end and as long as the violence
continues the hunger will spread
catherine guerra hunger BBC news
northern Uganda
